topics.body:
"@Herrpface":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/559871c26368722a9d000dc0#post_559871c26368722a9d000dc0
One film had a David Lynch style to it, another was just boring, the film after that was a horror. The only film I got engaged with was the first one, because it was interesting, the 2nd was boring and the 3rd felt like a ripoff of that film Vacancy. Didn't help that film had pretty bad acting.

The second half of the screening was better. One was a film about a man who could talk with his past and future self, another was about a woman who works at an insurance company, it's surprisingly interesting, and the last one was about a hikikomori.

topics.body:
"@Virgil Stormblade":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/559874b76368720e950021f0#post_559874b76368720e950021f0
[bq="Virgil Stormblade"]"@Kaz":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/559873fa6368720e9500209e#post_559873fa6368720e9500209e
Never heard of it. Why?[/bq]
It's a pretty good movie imo, here's the summary Martin is a troubled young man. With a mother who insists on treating him like a child, a stepfather who can't wait to see the back of him, and a brother with Down's Syndrome shut away in an institution, is it any wonder he retreats into an alternate personality - that of six-year-old Georgie? It is Georgie who befriends Susan Harper, but friendship soon turns into obsession. When Susan begins to distance herself, something inside Georgie snaps and he embarks on a killing spree, with Susan as the next target.
